name: gdown
description: Google Drive Public File Downloader when Curl/Wget Fails
readme_summary: gdown is a Python-based command-line and library tool designed to download public files and folders from Google Drive. It overcomes limitations of tools like curl and wget by handling Google Drive's security notices for large files, enabling recursive folder downloads, and allowing specification of download formats for Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides.
key_features: Skip Google Drive security notices for large files
Recursive download of Google Drive folders (up to 50 files per folder)
Specify download file format (e.g., PDF, XML, CSV) for Google Workspace documents
Command-line interface and Python library for integration
Support for downloading files via URL or file ID
Fuzzy matching for extracting file IDs from various Google Drive URLs
Option to download to standard output
Cached downloads with hash verification
primary_use_case: Downloading public files and folders from Google Drive, especially large files or when standard tools like curl/wget fail due to Google Drive's specific download protocols and security measures.
cover_image_prompt: A digital librarian character confidently navigating a vast, organized library of cloud storage. Instead of traditional books, the shelves are filled with glowing Google Drive icons. The librarian is holding a special 'key' (representing the gdown tool) that unlocks a large, secure vault labeled 'Large Files'. From this vault, data streams are flowing out, transforming into various formats like PDF documents and zip archives. In the background, a small, stylized representation of a command line interface and Python code snippets are subtly integrated into the library's architecture, indicating the tool's technical nature. The overall mood is one of efficient and secure data retrieval. The style should be a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration with clear iconography and a clean, modern aesthetic.

name: floccus
description: :cloud: Sync your bookmarks privately across browsers and devices
readme_summary: Floccus is a browser extension that synchronizes your bookmarks privately across different browsers and devices. It supports various cloud storage services and WebDAV-compatible providers, allowing for customizable sync strategies and intervals.
key_features: Syncs native browser bookmarks directly
Supports sync via Nextcloud Bookmarks, Linkwarden, KaraKeep, Google Drive, Git servers, and WebDAV
Compatible with browsers supporting Web extensions (Firefox, Chrome, Edge, etc.)
Offers an Android/iOS app for mobile access
Allows multiple sync profiles
Configurable sync strategy (uni- or bidirectional), interval, and folder
Easy export of configuration
primary_use_case: Synchronizing browser bookmarks privately across multiple browsers and devices using a user-chosen cloud storage provider.
cover_image_prompt: A magical, interconnected library where each book represents a browser bookmark. A central, glowing conduit is actively duplicating and distributing these books to various shelves, each labeled with different browser logos (Firefox, Chrome, Edge) and device icons (phone, tablet). Subtle digital streams of data flow between the conduit and the shelves, indicating private synchronization. The Floccus logo is subtly integrated into the library's architecture. The scene is rendered in a warm, inviting digital painting style with clear outlines and a focus on the seamless transfer of information, emphasizing privacy and accessibility.

name: kimi-cli
description: Kimi Code CLI is your next CLI agent.
readme_summary: Kimi Code CLI is an AI-powered command-line agent designed to assist with software development tasks and terminal operations. It can read and edit code, execute shell commands, fetch web content, and autonomously plan actions, integrating with various IDEs and shells.
key_features: Shell command mode for direct terminal command execution
VS Code extension for seamless integration
IDE integration via Agent Client Protocol (ACP)
Zsh integration for enhanced shell experience
Support for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools
primary_use_case: To act as an AI agent within the terminal, assisting developers with coding, shell commands, and other development-related tasks.
cover_image_prompt: A wise, anthropomorphic owl wearing a small terminal headset, perched on a branch made of glowing code. The owl is actively directing a stream of digital data (represented by glowing particles) into a complex, intricate clockwork mechanism that is assembling lines of code and executing shell commands. Small, subtle UI elements showing code snippets and terminal output are integrated into the clockwork. The background is a softly lit, abstract digital landscape. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, modern aesthetic and a color palette of blues, greens, and purples, emphasizing intelligence and automation.

name: ai-agents-from-scratch
description: Demystify AI agents by building them yourself. Local LLMs, no black boxes, real understanding of function calling, memory, and ReAct patterns.
readme_summary: This repository provides a hands-on, step-by-step guide to building AI agents from scratch using local LLMs and Node.js. It demystifies agent architecture, function calling, memory, and ReAct patterns by explaining design decisions and visualizing internal processes, aiming to build a deep understanding before utilizing production frameworks.
key_features: Build AI agents from first principles
Utilize local LLMs (via node-llama-cpp)
Understand function calling, memory, and ReAct patterns
Demystify agent architectures and framework design choices
Hands-on learning series with code examples and explanations
Progressive learning path from basic LLM interaction to complex agent behavior
primary_use_case: Educational resource for learning the fundamental concepts and implementation details of AI agents by building them locally, without relying on high-level frameworks.
cover_image_prompt: A curious inventor in a workshop, assembling a complex clockwork automaton piece by piece. Gears, wires, and glowing LLM cores are scattered around. The automaton is shown in a 'thinking' pose, with a thought bubble containing simple code snippets and data flow diagrams. Small screens on the workbench display the repository's name and a simplified visualization of the ReAct pattern. The overall mood is one of discovery and understanding, with warm, focused lighting. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clear, clean lines and a slightly stylized, approachable aesthetic.

name: DumpGuard
description: Proof-of-Concept tool for extracting NTLMv1 hashes from sessions on modern Windows systems.
readme_summary: DumpGuard is a proof-of-concept C tool designed to extract NTLMv1 credential hashes from modern Windows systems. It leverages the Remote Credential Guard protocol to bypass local Credential Guard protections, enabling credential dumping even when Credential Guard is enabled.
key_features: Extracts NTLMv1 hashes from user sessions.
Bypasses local Credential Guard using the Remote Credential Guard protocol.
Supports dumping own session credentials without elevated privileges (requires SPN account).
Supports dumping all session credentials with SYSTEM privileges (requires SPN account).
Includes implementations of interfaces exposed by Credential Guard for research.
primary_use_case: Security research and testing of credential extraction techniques on Windows systems, particularly in environments with Credential Guard enabled.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled locksmith, using a specialized, glowing skeleton key, is effortlessly opening a heavily fortified vault labeled 'Windows Credential Guard'. Inside the vault, spectral user icons are visible, and the locksmith's key is extracting shimmering NTLMv1 hash symbols. The background shows a dimly lit, secure server room with subtle digital circuit patterns. Small screens on the wall display abstract data streams and the 'DumpGuard' logo. The overall mood is one of clever infiltration and data retrieval. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a dark, high-tech color palette and dramatic lighting.
